Sentence.sentence: The fear of massive copying.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: After the failure of Lehman Brothers, many of the world’s largest banks feared the worst as the collapse of the housing bubble exposed investments in risky loans.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: No one should have to live with what a Texas mother described as constant stress, tension, even fear about money.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: When we can't actually remove the source of our fear, we tend to adapt psychologically by adopting a range of defence mechanisms, says Tom Crompton, change strategist for the environmental organisation World Wide Fund for Nature.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Educators may fear that children hearing two languages will become permanently confused and thus their language development will be delayed ;this concern is not documented in the literature.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: What distinguishes a depression from a harsh recession is paralyzing fear - fear of the unknown so great that it causes consumers, businesses, and investors to retreat and panic.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Regardless, all these complex measures had the same psychological purpose: to reassure people that the free fall would stop and, thereby, curb the fear that would perpetuate (使持久) a free fall.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: To curb the fear of a lasting free fall
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: On occasions it is the fear that certain disclosures may be unacceptable to family or friends that motivates an individual to seek professional help.
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: And though Hu Jintao and the rest of the Chinese leadership aren't inclined to lecture visiting Presidents, he might gently hint that Beijing is getting a little nervous about the value of the dollar-which has fallen 15% since March, in large part because of increasing fears that America's debt load is becoming unmanageable.
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Still others emphasize the role of race, arguing that foreigners add to the nation's fears and insecurities.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: It seems that men with traditional views of masculinity are more likely to suppress outward emotions and to fear emotions, supposedly because such feelings may lead to a loss of composure (镇定).
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: They have aroused fear among the residents.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: "When we can't actually remove the source of our fear, we tend to adapt psychologically by adopting a range of defence mechanisms," says Tom Crompton, change strategist for the environmental organisation World wide Fund for Nature.
Sentence.come: 2015年12月六级真题（第二套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: My grandfather spoke of his greatest fear, that of leaving the only home they had known for the past 60 years.
Sentence.come: 2015年12月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section C

Sentence.sentence: Some fear that the potential impact of sharing is too high, especially at the early stages of a career.
Sentence.come: 2017年12月六级真题（第二套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: The amygdala is a crucial part of the brain that produces fear, anxiety and emotional responses including that sinking, guilty feeling you get when you lie.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: The robotics revolution is set to bring humans face to face with an old fear—man-made creations as smart and capable as we are but without a moral compass.
Sentence.come: 2016年6月六级真题（第二套）阅读 Section A

Sentence.sentence: These emotions included interest, joy, surprise, sadness, anger, disgust, contempt, and fear.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section C

Sentence.sentence: They fear I will default on any business loan I'm given.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月六级真题（第二套）听力 Section A

means: failure effects analysis report 故障影响分析报告

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"恐惧，惧怕，惊恐"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: alarm, fear, fright, horror, panic, terror, dread
means: alarm ：强调突然意识到有危险而产生的恐惧心理。
fear ：普通用词，侧重指面临危险或灾祸时内心所引起的恐惧心情。
fright ：通常指一阵突然的、令人震惊的短暂恐惧，有时含夸张意味。
horror ：侧重指因看到令人讨厌或危险的东西或情景而引起的厌恶情绪、极度恐惧心情或战栗的动作。
panic ：常指因突如其来的外界威胁使人群出现惊慌、恐惧或混乱。
terror ：指极大的恐惧和惊骇，语气最强。
dread ：可与fear换用，着重害怕的心理，但dread常指胆怯和丧失勇气。

word_mean: 恐惧，畏惧：外界实在的恐吓或危险引起的心理和心理生理反应所组成的情绪状态，参见anxiety

Sentence.sentence: According to the passage, children's fear and dislike of books may result from being made to read aloud before others.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语浙江卷 阅读理解 阅读A 题设

Sentence.sentence: After having taught fifth-grade classes for four years, I decided to try all costs to rid them of their fear and dislike of books, and to get them to read oftener and more adventurously.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语浙江卷 阅读理解 阅读A 原文

Sentence.sentence: As I began my own personal weight program, I was filled with the fear that I would.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语天津卷 完形填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: For the risk-seekers a part of the brain related to pleasure becomes active, while for the rest of us, a part of the brain related to fear becomes active.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语北京卷 阅读理解 阅读E 原文

Sentence.sentence: He fears the worst, but hopes for the best.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语浙江卷 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: I was ready to pay for my bananas at the grocery one night, when fear seized me.
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语天津卷 完形填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: If you fear the heyday of the snowman has passed, don't worry: I've learned that some explosive snowman history is still being made today.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语上海卷 阅读理解 阅读A 原文

Sentence.sentence: In most cities the sky looks as though it has been emptied of stars, leaving behind a vacant haze that mirrors our fear of the dark.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语浙江卷 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: It was usually because I had let fear of failure stop me from trying at all.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语天津卷 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: Many farmers opposed the plan because they feared that wolves would kill their farm animals or pets.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语全国卷3 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: Many people fear the gym because they feel lost and don't want to embarrass themselves.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语福建卷 阅读理解 阅读E 原文

Sentence.sentence: Nervousness and fear were replaced with joy.
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语全国卷2 完形填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: Some people fear such changes will be for the worse, while some see chances, not disaster.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语广东卷 完形填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: They fear losing control of their workers.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语浙江卷（10月） 阅读理解 阅读C 选项

Sentence.sentence: Thus humans who lived a million years ago, despite their big brains and sharp stone tools, lived in constant fear of meat-eating animals.
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 任务型阅读 原文

Sentence.sentence: While some people are motivated by a need for success, others are motivated by a fear of failure.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语江苏卷 单项填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: While the fear hung over my head, there were also signs that I was headed down the right street.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语天津卷 完形填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: And dead markets partly reflect the paralysis of banks which will not sell assets for fear of booking losses, yet are reluctant to buy all those supposed bargains.
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: While Europe’s monarchies will no doubt be smart enough to survive for some time to come, it is the British royals who have most to fear from the Spanish example.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Elected leaders must be allowed to help supporters deal with bureaucratic problems without fear of prosecution for bribery.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Elected leaders must be allowed to help supporters deal with bureaucratic problems without fear of prosecution of bribery.
Sentence.come: 2017年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: Fear is both useful and harmful.
Sentence.come: 2015年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: My favorite actor will smith once said, "Fear is not real."
Sentence.come: 2015年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: One answer is fear, according to Jon Wortmann, an executive mental coach.
Sentence.come: 2015年考研真题（英语二）完形填空 Section Ⅰ

Sentence.sentence: There's always a constant fear of falling behind everyone else on the socially perpetuated "race to the finish line," whether that be toward graduate school, medical school or a lucrative career.
Sentence.come: 2017年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: Unlike so-called basic emotions such as sadness, fear, and anger, guilt emerges a little later, in conjunction with a child's growing grasp of social and moral norms.
Sentence.come: 2019年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: We fear rejection, or that our innocent social advances will be misinterpreted as "weird".
Sentence.come: 2015年考研真题（英语二）完形填空 Section Ⅰ

Sentence.sentence: While Europe's monarchies will no doubt be smart enough to survive for some time to come, it is the British royals who have most to fear from the Spanish example.
Sentence.come: 2015年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

sentences.en: He couldn't move for fear.
sentences.cn: 他害怕得动弹不得。

sentences.en: There is no fear of that happening.
sentences.cn: 那事绝不可能发生。

令人害怕的事物，可怕的事物
畏惧, 害怕, 担心

sentences.en: He did not fear to die.
sentences.cn: 他不怕死。

sentences.en: Experts fear that there will be new outbreak of the disease.
sentences.cn: 专家们担心这种疾病会再度流行。

sentences.en: They feared the worst.
sentences.cn: 他们担心会发生最坏的情况。

sentences.en: Never fear—I will hold your hand.
sentences.cn: 别怕, 我会握住你的手。

jx.jx_en_mean: to avoid the risk of (or that)

lj.lj_ly: no one dared refuse the order for fear of losing their job.
lj.lj_ls: 没人敢违抗命令，以免失业。

lj.lj_ly: we shall meet again, never fear.
lj.lj_ls: 我们还会见面的，别担心。

jx.jx_en_mean: (Brit. informal)used as an emphatic expression of denial or refusal
jx.jx_cn_mean: (英，非正式)［表断然否认或拒绝］绝不，当然不

lj.lj_ly: ‘Are you coming with me?’ ‘No fear—it's too exciting here.’.
lj.lj_ls: “你要和我一块去吗？”“当然不——这儿真够劲。”。

phrase.cizu_name: put the fear of God in (或 into) someone

jx.jx_en_mean: cause someone to be very frightened

lj.lj_ly: take all your decisions without fear or favour.
lj.lj_ls: 公正地作出你所有的决定。

entry.def: Fear is the unpleasant feeling you have when you think that you are in danger.

example.ex: I was sitting on the floor shivering with fear.
example.tran: 我坐在地板上，吓得发抖。

example.ex: ...boyhood memories of sickness and fear of the dark...
example.tran: 儿时记忆中的病痛和对黑暗的恐惧

entry.def: If you fear someone or something, you are frightened because you think that they will harm you.

example.ex: Many people fear change because they do not like the old ways to be disrupted.
example.tran: 很多人惧怕变化，因为他们不喜欢旧有的生活方式遭到破坏。

entry.def: A fear is a thought that something unpleasant might happen or might have happened.

example.ex: These youngsters are motivated not by a desire to achieve, but by fear of failure...
example.tran: 激发这些年轻人的不是对成就的渴望，而是对失败的担心。

example.ex: Then one day his worst fears were confirmed...
example.tran: 后来有一天，他最担心的事终于发生了。

entry.def: If you fear something unpleasant or undesirable, you are worried that it might happen or might have happened.

example.ex: She had feared she was going down with pneumonia or bronchitis...
example.tran: 她担心会得肺炎或支气管炎。

example.ex: More than two million refugees have fled the area, fearing attack by loyalist forces.
example.tran: 两百多万难民担心受到效忠旧政府的势力的攻击而逃离该地区。

entry.def: If you say that there is a fear that something unpleasant or undesirable will happen, you mean that you think it is possible or likely.
entry.tran: (坏事发生的)可能性，机会，几率

example.ex: There was no fear that anything would be misunderstood...
example.tran: 并无引起误会的可能性。

example.ex: There is a fear that the freeze on bank accounts could prove a lasting deterrent to investors.
example.tran: 人们担心冻结银行账户可能会长期阻碍投资。

entry.def: If you fear for someone or something, you are very worried because you think that they might be in danger.

example.ex: Carla fears for her son...
example.tran: 卡拉为儿子担心。

example.ex: He fled on Friday, saying he feared for his life.
example.tran: 他星期五逃走了，说是担心自己有生命危险。

entry.def: If you have fears for someone or something, you are very worried because you think that they might be in danger.

example.ex: He also spoke of his fears for the future of his country's culture.
example.tran: 他也谈到了对祖国文化前途的担忧。

example.ex: ...fear for her own safety.
example.tran: 对她自己安全的担心

entry.def: If you fear to do something, you are afraid to do it or you do not wish to do it.

example.ex: She pursed her lips together, as though fearing to betray her news...
example.tran: 她闭紧双唇，仿佛害怕透露出她的消息。

example.ex: Old people fear to leave their homes.
example.tran: 老年人都不愿背井离乡。

entry.def: You say that you fear that a situation is the case when the situation is unpleasant or undesirable, and when you want to express sympathy, sorrow, or regret about it.

example.ex: I fear that a land war now looks very probable...
example.tran: 恐怕陆地战爆发的可能性很大。

example.ex: 'Is anything left at all?' — 'I fear not.'
example.tran: “留下什么东西了吗?” ——“恐怕没有。”

entry.def: If you are in fear of doing or experiencing something unpleasant or undesirable, you are very worried that you might have to do it or experience it.
entry.tran: 在对…的担心之中;在对…的恐惧之中

example.ex: The elderly live in fear of assault and murder.
example.tran: 老人们生活在对袭击和谋杀的恐惧之中。

entry.def: If you take a particular course of action for fear of something, you take the action in order to prevent that thing happening.

example.ex: She was afraid to say anything to them for fear of hurting their feelings...
example.tran: 她什么都不敢对他们说，以免伤害他们的感情。

example.ex: No one dared shoot for fear of hitting Pete.
example.tran: 没人敢开枪，怕伤着皮特。

entry.def: You say 'fear not' or 'never fear' to someone when you are telling them not to worry or be frightened.

example.ex: Fear not, Darlene will protect me...
example.tran: 别担心，达琳会保护我的。

example.ex: You'll get the right training, never fear.
example.tran: 你会受到正规训练的，别担心。

entry.def: You use 'no fear' to emphasize that you do not want to do something.

example.ex: When I asked him if he wanted to change his mind, William said 'No fear.'
example.tran: 我问威廉是否想改主意，他说：“绝不会。”

entry.def: If someone or something puts the fear of God into you, they frighten or worry you, often deliberately.

example.ex: At some time or other Eve had obviously put the fear of God into her.
example.tran: 显然伊芙时不时有意吓唬她一下。

means.word_mean: 1. an emotion experienced in anticipation of some specific pain or danger (usually accompanied by a desire to flee or fight)

sentences.sentence: "they hushed it up out of fear of public reaction"

means.word_mean: 3. a profound emotion inspired by a deity;
1. be afraid or feel anxious or apprehensive about a possible or probable situation or event;
2. be afraid or scared of; be frightened of;
3. be sorry; used to introduce an unpleasant statement;

sentences.sentence: "I fear I won't make it to your wedding party"
"I fear the results of the final exams"

means.word_mean: 5. regard with feelings of respect and reverence; consider hallowed or exalted or be in awe of;

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English fǣr 'calamity, danger', fǣran 'frighten', also 'revere', of Germanic origin; related to Dutch gevaar and German Gefahr 'danger'

means: failure effects analysis report 故障影响分析报告

sentences.cn: 下决心到达自己目的地的流浪者,绝不会惧怕下雨. 既然选择了前方,便只顾风雨兼程.汪国真.
sentences.en: A wanderer who is determined to reach his destination will never fear the rain.

sentences.cn: 要在暗地射完全人. 他们忽然射他, 并不惧怕.
sentences.en: They shoot from ambush at the innocent man; they shoot at him suddenly, without fear.

sentences.cn: 不要惧怕,你们比许多麻雀还贵重!
sentences.en: Fear not therefore: ye are of more value than many sparrows.

sentences.cn: 亚多尼雅惧怕所罗门 、 起来、抓住祭坛的角.
sentences.en: But Adonijah, in fear of Solomon, went and took hold of the horns of the altar.

sentences.cn: 经济衰退的大环境下,惧怕失业的情绪使得事情变得更糟.
sentences.en: Fears about job losses during the recession are likely to be making matters worse.

sentences.cn: 暗黑之星的元神在他面前闪着光,他的愤怒和傲慢渐渐变成了惧怕, 隐隐生痛.
sentences.en: Anger and arrogance turned to fear, raw and ragged, as the Darkstar shimmered before him.

sentences.cn: 20犯罪的人,当在众人面前责备他, 叫其馀的人也可以惧怕.
sentences.en: Them that sin rebuke before all, that others also may fear.

sentences.cn: 这些困难可能导致他们终身 惧怕 数学.
sentences.en: Difficulties like these can lead to a lifelong faire ( fear ) of mathematics.

sentences.cn: 狒狒惧怕蛇, 也有很好的记忆力.
sentences.en: Baboons have a fear of snakes. They also have good memories.

sentences.cn: 撒迦利亚看见, 就大为震才,觉得惧怕.
sentences.en: When Zechariah saw him , he was startled and gripped with fear.

sentences.cn: 但是美国人生活在希望中, 而不是惧怕中.
sentences.en: But Americans live in hope, not in fear.

sentences.cn: 弱者惧怕孤独, 因为他们不能想象独自生活会是什么样子.
sentences.en: The weak fear of loneliness, because they can not imagine living alone like son.

sentences.cn: 演员都惧怕这位批评家辛辣尖刻的笔调.
sentences.en: Actors feared the critic's mordant pen.

sentences.cn: 惧怕与人类接触是阿拉斯代尔-格雷的小说《 拉纳克 》的主题.
sentences.en: The fear of human contact is central to Alasdair Gray's novel'Lanark '.

sentences.cn: 在那里, 孩子能够在很小的时候就懂得不用惧怕鲨鱼.
sentences.en: There, kids can learn, from an early age, not to fear sharks.

sentences.cn: 只有充满遗憾的人才惧怕死亡.
sentences.en: The only people who fear death are those with regrets.

sentences.cn: 那武士在战斗中毫不感到惧怕.
sentences.en: The knight felt no fear in the midst of battle.

sentences.cn: 然后它又开始惧怕黑豹, 因此,魔法师把它变成了一只黑豹.
sentences.en: Then it began to fear the panther, so the magician turned it into a panther.

sentences.cn: 让我们永远不要因为惧怕而谈判, 让我们永远不要惧怕谈判.
sentences.en: Let us never negotiate out of fear. But let us never fear to negotiate.

sentences.cn: 众人屏息在旁观看.那父亲则在希望与惧怕交织的剧痛之中.
sentences.en: The multitude looked on with bated breath, the father in an agony of hope and fear.

sentences.cn: 他们反对是出于惧怕和无知.
sentences.en: Their opposition stems from fear and ignorance.

sentences.cn: 只要我们紧密地团结, 就不必惧怕外来侵略.
sentences.en: So long as we are firmly united, we need fear no aggression.

sentences.cn: 他看不见现在, 他惧怕未来, 所以他才回忆过去呢.
sentences.en: He can't see the present, he fears the future, and so he looks back.

sentences.cn: 我不敢与你讲的最后一句话, 不惧怕满足一个残酷的死亡!
sentences.en: I dare with you to speak the last words, does not fear meets a cruel death!

Sentence.sentence: Traditional Ukrainian decorated eggs also spoke to those fears.

Sentence.sentence: The worst fear Leah ever had was the prospect of losing her yoga business.

Sentence.sentence: Steering through change and facing obstacles brings us face to face with our fears.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Leah reflects on one incident that triggered her fears, when her investors threatened to shut her down: I was probably up against the most fear I've ever had, she says.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Leah gained confidence by laying out her fears and confronting them directly.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: I was feeling so intentional and strong that I wasn't going to let fear just take over.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: For most of us, letting go of the safety and security of the past gives us great fear.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Calling out our fears explicitly, as Leah did, can help us act decisively.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: By naming her fears and facing them head-on, Leah gained confidence.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: When your elderly relative needs to enter some sort of long-term care facility—a moment few parents or children approach without fear—what you would like is to have everything made clear.

Sentence.sentence: The daughter feared her mother would be ignored there, and so she decided to move her into a more welcoming facility.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Such moves may eliminate the fears of those living in the exporting countries, but they are creating panic in importing countries that must rely on what is then left for export.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Does assisted living really mark a great improvement over a nursing home, or has the industry simply hired better interior designers? Are nursing homes as bad as people fear, or is that an out-moded stereotype ( ' ,  固定 看法 )? Can doing one's homework really steer families to the best places? It is genuinely hard to know.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: With wired setups, the fear is that a burglar ( ' ,  入室盗贼) might be able to shut your system down simply by cutting the right cable.

Sentence.sentence: They feared neither spouse could manage alone.

Sentence.sentence: But children are frequently discouraged from involvement with natural spaces, for health and safety reasons, for fear that they might get dirty or that they might cause damage.
